tweet: The #SCOTUS #gerrymandering decision highlights the need for Congress to take action. Last week, I secured funding in one of the House spending packages for @NSF to study & establish science-based best practices for congressional redistricting so we can ensure a fair process.

The spreading of political disinformation on social media poses grave consequences to our nation’s democracy. That’s why my @EnergyCommerce colleagues & I sent a letter to Mark Zuckerberg with questions about @facebook's handling of the doctored video of Speaker Pelosi. pic.twitter.com/PGK1ZN2t26

Two amendments that I introduced were included in yesterday's spending package that passed on the House floor. #CBD #Gerrymandering https://mcnerney.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-mcnerney-cbd-amendment-and-amendment-to-combat-gerrymandering …

Six years ago, SCOTUS gutted the Voting Rights Act in the Shelby County v. Holder decision. Millions of Americans were left vulnerable to racial discrimination & voter disenfranchisement, unraveling the legacy of this momentous legislation. We must #RestoreTheVote & pass #HR4.

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, creating jobs and driving innovation. H.R.3351 makes substantial investments in resources for entrepreneurs & small businesses – like the 30,000 in my district – by providing access to training & materials to help them succeed.

We must renew our commitment to protecting the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the planet we all call home. That’s why I support the FY20 Interior-Environment bill, which includes $37.3 billion to protect the environment, ensure clean air & water, & preserve wildlife. pic.twitter.com/FqbZOJw1b0

I introduced two amendments that passed on the House floor this week. One directs the FDA to set safe consumption levels for #CBD products, and the other tackles the widespread problem of #gerrymandering. pic.twitter.com/DKW3j2QIb3

With a recorded 70.8 million displaced people fleeing violence & persecution around the world, there is still much work to do. That’s why I'm proud to join my colleagues in recognizing #WorldRefugeeDay by cosponsoring H.Res. 444 to reaffirm U.S. commitment to protecting refugees.

Millions of women, #LGBTQ Americans, and people of color rely on the Affordable Care Act, but the Trump administration is threatening their health by trying to roll back critical protections. We need to #PutPatientsFirst and keep discrimination out of our healthcare.

@HouseDemocrats are pushing forward funding legislation #ForThePeople. That why the FY2020 Commerce-Justice-Science bill provides $74 billion to promote civil rights, reduce gun violence, combat climate change, & address many other issues that are important to Americans. pic.twitter.com/z9b5TdAMpl

Today, my colleagues & I sent a letter to @AjitPaiFCC urging him to move forward with taking a fresh look at the 5.9 GHz band. It’s time we re-examine how this band is being used & how to allocate it in a way that meets the demands of our times & best serves the American people. pic.twitter.com/fWZUSKBuUQ

The Trump administration is moving forward with their #DirtyPowerScam – gutting the #CleanPowerPlan & rolling back the progress we’ve made on climate change solutions. @EPAAWheeler is once again putting polluter profits over Americans’ best interests.

Today marks the longest period in U.S. history without an increase to the federal minimum wage since it's establishment in 1938. No one working full-time in this country should be living in poverty. It's time to #RaiseTheWage. pic.twitter.com/jiEz1DtslR

Hate has no place here. As we celebrate #Pride, let us recognize the important history of the #LGBT community and that we still have more to do to make our nation a fairer, more just country. pic.twitter.com/O0mUaToC6A
Whether he doesn’t understand the law or doesn’t care about it, the president’s indifference on election interference is a threat to our democracy and to our very way of life.

Once again, President Trump is using his media platform to make lawless activity seem normal. But the American people understand that any foreign entity offering campaign information has ulterior motives.

More than 5,000 people are diagnosed with ALS every year. I’ve long supported federal funding for ALS research and will continue to do so until a cure is found. Thanks to @alsassociation for meeting with me to discuss how Congress can continue to support #ALSAdvocacy. pic.twitter.com/FtrUFf70v3

#PublicCharge is a rule that would allow the Trump administration to restrict green cards based on income, health, English proficiency, age & use of public programs. This proposal is another cruel attack on #immigrant communities.

For the first time in more than 20 years, we have an appropriations package that includes funding for @CDCgov & @NIH to conduct gun violence prevention research. I'm proud to stand with my @HouseDemocrats colleagues in the fight for a safer America #ForThePeople.

Nearly 30 MILLION Americans are living without health insurance, and another 40 million cannot afford their co-pays or deductibles. We can do better. Today’s @WaysmeansCmte hearing on universal coverage is a step toward making #MedicareforAll a reality.

Congratulations to this year’s Military Academy appointees! These six exemplary students from California’s 9th Congressional District are going on to attend the Military Academy, Naval Academy and Air Force Academy. pic.twitter.com/zpFjcf8wM3

It’s been more than 2 months since the House passed the #SaveTheNet Act, and Americans across the political spectrum agree that we need to restore #NetNeutrality rules. But today @SenateMajLdr blocked a vote on it in the Senate, burying it in his legislative graveyard. pic.twitter.com/3fkovF8UtB

On one of the darkest days in our nation’s history, our 9/11 first responders risked everything to help their fellow Americans. With the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund set to expire, we cannot turn our backs on these heroes. #Renew911VCF

As we celebrate #ImmigrantHeritageMonth, the House passage of the Dream & Promise Act is a reminder that much our nation’s success is due to our commitment to welcoming new communities. #HR6 pic.twitter.com/MQ787cJzqi

That’s why I’m proud to support critical legislation essential to the preservation of our oceans. pic.twitter.com/YcGzvSHHpc

Today we heard from many #FosterYouthVoices about their personal experiences & how we can improve our child welfare system. I had the privilege of hosting a young woman named Erica, who has become an advocate on this issue & many other issues affecting young people in America. pic.twitter.com/oXKpjONfa7

Over 415k children are living in foster care in the U.S. Tomorrow, I'll be participating in #FosterYouthShadowDay as foster youth from across the country will meet with Members of Congress to talk about how government can improve our child welfare system.  #FosterYouthVoices

Two years ago today, the president decided to pull out of the Paris Climate Agreement and put the future of nation’s economy and public health at risk. I voted for the #ClimateActionNow Act, which blocks Trump from removing us. America can either lead or be left behind.
